summary.span: 表示抽象类，用于控制由 类执行的序列化。

span.span: Represents an abstract class used for controlling serialization by the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在初始化过程，.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构动态生成并编译的临时序列化，它派生自抽象类类。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for serialization that is derived from the abstract class. 此外实现在.NET Framework 中的序列化和到 XML 文档的对象。 is also implemented within the .NET Framework for serialization of and objects into XML documents. 不应派生的类。You should not derive classes from . 而应调用方法。Instead, call the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 受保护的成员专门用于仅由.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构在内部使用的派生类。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. 在初始化过程，.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构动态生成并编译的临时序列化，它派生自类。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for serialization that is derived from . 在此过程中，.NET Framework 生成写入方法，实现委托。During this process, the .NET Framework generates write methods that implement the delegate. 它会因此对于某些.NET Framework 类型和 XML 数据类型，通过 SOAP 编码的 XML 序列化，并且不是根元素之间的映射。It does so for certain mappings between .NET Framework types and XML data types that are serialized via SOAP-encoded XML and are not root elements. 然后，根据需要，在序列化过程中调用 write 方法。Then, as necessary, a write method is called during serialization. 不应直接创建的实例。You should not directly create an instance of . SOAP 1.1 规范第 5 节中介绍了 SOAP 编码。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法从无效的源写入有效的 XML。The method writes valid XML from invalid sources. 例如，属性类可以包含空格，作为 XML 无效。For example, the property of the class can contain spaces, which are invalid as XML. 方法读取编码的 XML 并将其还原到原始值。The method reads the encoded XML and restores it to the original value. 但是，方法无法读取这类经过编码的 XML。However, the method of the cannot read such encoded XML. 在这种情况下，设置属性`false`禁用 XML 编码。In that case, set the property to `false` to disable the encoding of the XML.

summary.span: 初始化 委托的一个实例，以序列化 SOAP 编码的 XML 数据。

span.span: Initializes an instances of the delegate to serialize SOAP-encoded XML data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 受保护的成员专门用于仅由.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构在内部使用的派生类。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. 在初始化过程，.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构动态生成并编译的临时序列化，它派生自类。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for serialization that is derived from . 在此过程中，.NET Framework 生成写入方法，实现委托。During this process, the .NET Framework generates write methods that implement the delegate. 它会因此对于某些.NET Framework 类型和 XML 数据类型，使用 SOAP 编码的 XML 进行序列化，并且不是根元素之间的映射。It does so for certain mappings between .NET Framework types and XML data types that are serialized using SOAP-encoded XML and are not root elements. 然后，根据需要，在序列化过程中调用 write 方法。Then, as necessary, a write method is called during serialization. 抽象方法是临时的派生的类创建的实例，其中初始化编写回调方法。The abstract method is where the temporary derived class creates an instance of and initializes write callback methods. 不应直接创建的实例。You should not directly create an instance of . SOAP 1.1 规范第 5 节中介绍了 SOAP 编码。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 受保护的成员专门用于仅由.NET Framework XML 序列化基础结构在内部使用的派生类。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. SOAP 编码允许唯一的 XML 元素作为 SOAP 消息中出现一次`multiRef`标识元素`id`属性。SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute. `id`值可由引用多次`href`属性 (或`ref`SOAP 1.2 中的属性) 替换元素中。The `id` value can be referenced multiple times by `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements. SOAP 1.1 规范第 5 节中介绍了 SOAP 编码。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
